comment.author: 16738264@N00
comment._content: My mom has a sash she believes to be similar which is purple, white, and gold -- says that earlier sashes are sometimes also gold, green, and white -- saw people wearing replicas (purple, white, gold) during ERA marches in the 1970s.  Hers is felt, black letters, circa 1913.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org then-and-now post Commons Inspired Suffragette Costume -- it's inspiring indeed!

comment.author: 96684819@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called 1910s Fashion & Costume, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 8716770@N08
comment._content: The banner is the back is from the National American Women Suffrage Association and I think Miss Jenkins also led the Suffrage Pilgrims in 1913 but this picture may be from a different moment.
